Chunk a Markdown document

Source: R/markdown-chunk.R
markdown_chunk.Rd

markdown_chunk() splits a single Markdown string into fixed-length, optionally overlapping chunks while nudging cut points to the nearest sensible boundary (heading, paragraph, sentence, line, word, or character). It returns a tibble recording the character ranges of each chunk and, if requested, the heading context and the text itself.

Usage

markdown_chunk(
  md,
  target_size = 1600L,
  target_overlap = 0.5,
  ...,
  max_snap_dist = target_size * (1 - target_overlap)/3,
  headings = TRUE,
  pre_segment_heading_levels = integer(),
  text = TRUE
)

Arguments

md

A length-one character vector containing Markdown.

target_size

Integer. Target chunk size in characters. Default: 1600 (≈ 400 tokens, or 1 page of text).

target_overlap

Numeric in [0, 1). Fraction of desired overlap between successive chunks. Default: 0.5. Even when 0, some overlap can occur because the last chunk is anchored to the document end.

...

Must be empty.

max_snap_dist

Integer. Furthest distance (in characters) a cut point may move to reach a boundary. Defaults to one third of the stride size between target chunk starts. Chunks that end up on identical boundaries are merged.

headings

Logical. Add a headings column containing the Markdown headings in scope at each chunk start. Default: TRUE.

pre_segment_heading_levels

Integer vector with possible values 1:6. Headings at these levels are treated as hard segment breaks before chunking. Default: disabled.

text

Logical. If TRUE, include a text column with the chunk contents. Default: TRUE.

Value

A tibble with at least:

  • start: 1-based start position of the chunk in md.

  • end: inclusive end position.

Additional headings and/or text columns are present when requested.

Examples

md <- "
# Title

## Section 1

Some text that is long enough to be chunked.

A second paragraph to make the text even longer.

## Section 2

More text here.

### Section 2.1

Some text under a level three heading.

#### Section 2.1.1

Some text under a level four heading.

## Section 3

Even more text here.
"

markdown_chunk(md, target_size = 40)
#>    start end
#> 1      1  39
#> 2     25  60
#> 3     40  79
#> 4     61 101
#> 5     80 120
#> 6    102 134
#> 7    121 166
#> 8    135 178
#> 9    167 206
#> 10   179 226
#> 11   207 238
#> 12   227 266
#> 13   239 281
#> 14   267 301
#> 15   268 302
#>                                                      headings
#> 1                                                            
#> 2                                       # Title\n## Section 1
#> 3                                       # Title\n## Section 1
#> 4                                       # Title\n## Section 1
#> 5                                       # Title\n## Section 1
#> 6                                       # Title\n## Section 1
#> 7                                                     # Title
#> 8                                       # Title\n## Section 2
#> 9                      # Title\n## Section 2\n### Section 2.1
#> 10                     # Title\n## Section 2\n### Section 2.1
#> 11                     # Title\n## Section 2\n### Section 2.1
#> 12 # Title\n## Section 2\n### Section 2.1\n#### Section 2.1.1
#> 13 # Title\n## Section 2\n### Section 2.1\n#### Section 2.1.1
#> 14 # Title\n## Section 2\n### Section 2.1\n#### Section 2.1.1
#> 15                                                    # Title
#>                                                  text
#> 1        \n# Title\n\n## Section 1\n\nSome text that 
#> 2                Some text that is long enough to be 
#> 3          is long enough to be chunked.\n\nA second 
#> 4         chunked.\n\nA second paragraph to make the 
#> 5         paragraph to make the text even longer.\n\n
#> 6               text even longer.\n\n## Section 2\n\n
#> 7  ## Section 2\n\nMore text here.\n\n### Section 2.1
#> 8    More text here.\n\n### Section 2.1\n\nSome text 
#> 9          \n\nSome text under a level three heading.
#> 10 under a level three heading.\n\n#### Section 2.1.1
#> 11               \n\n#### Section 2.1.1\n\nSome text 
#> 12        \n\nSome text under a level four heading.\n
#> 13    under a level four heading.\n\n## Section 3\n\n
#> 14             \n## Section 3\n\nEven more text here.
#> 15             ## Section 3\n\nEven more text here.\n
markdown_chunk(md, target_size = 40, target_overlap = 0)
#>   start end                                                   headings
#> 1     1  39                                                           
#> 2    40  70                                      # Title\n## Section 1
#> 3    71 120                                      # Title\n## Section 1
#> 4   121 151                                                    # Title
#> 5   152 208                                      # Title\n## Section 2
#> 6   209 228                     # Title\n## Section 2\n### Section 2.1
#> 7   229 267 # Title\n## Section 2\n### Section 2.1\n#### Section 2.1.1
#> 8   268 302                                                    # Title
#>                                                            text
#> 1                  \n# Title\n\n## Section 1\n\nSome text that 
#> 2                             is long enough to be chunked.\n\n
#> 3          A second paragraph to make the text even longer.\n\n
#> 4                           ## Section 2\n\nMore text here.\n\n
#> 5 ### Section 2.1\n\nSome text under a level three heading.\n\n
#> 6                                        #### Section 2.1.1\n\n
#> 7                     Some text under a level four heading.\n\n
#> 8                        ## Section 3\n\nEven more text here.\n
markdown_chunk(md, target_size = 400, pre_segment_heading_levels = c(1, 2))
#>   start end headings
#> 1     1   1         
#> 2     2  10         
#> 3    11 120  # Title
#> 4   121 267  # Title
#> 5   268 302  # Title
#>                                                                                                                                                              text
#> 1                                                                                                                                                              \n
#> 2                                                                                                                                                     # Title\n\n
#> 3                                            ## Section 1\n\nSome text that is long enough to be chunked.\n\nA second paragraph to make the text even longer.\n\n
#> 4 ## Section 2\n\nMore text here.\n\n### Section 2.1\n\nSome text under a level three heading.\n\n#### Section 2.1.1\n\nSome text under a level four heading.\n\n
#> 5                                                                                                                          ## Section 3\n\nEven more text here.\n
markdown_chunk(md, target_size = 40, max_snap_dist = 100)
#>   start end                               headings
#> 1     1  10                                       
#> 2    11 120                                # Title
#> 3   121 151                                # Title
#> 4   152 208                  # Title\n## Section 2
#> 5   209 267 # Title\n## Section 2\n### Section 2.1
#> 6   268 302                                # Title
#>                                                                                                                   text
#> 1                                                                                                        \n# Title\n\n
#> 2 ## Section 1\n\nSome text that is long enough to be chunked.\n\nA second paragraph to make the text even longer.\n\n
#> 3                                                                                  ## Section 2\n\nMore text here.\n\n
#> 4                                                        ### Section 2.1\n\nSome text under a level three heading.\n\n
#> 5                                                      #### Section 2.1.1\n\nSome text under a level four heading.\n\n
#> 6                                                                               ## Section 3\n\nEven more text here.\n
